title: Great for pictures printed at Walgreens
author: Nat
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2025
review_text:
I used this tape to attach photos to five blank painting canvases that were stretched on frames. I only needed one piece of tape per picture. First, I arranged the photos how I wanted them. Then I flipped them over and stuch a small square of tape in the center of the back of each photo. Next, I peeled the backing off of the other side of tape and stuck it where I wanted it. It was easy to reposition the photos as needed. It was strong enough to hold the photo. The photo display was for my son‘s graduation party. It was easy to reposition the photos, and they did not fall off. This is perfect for indoor use. I do not know how it would hold up in wind or rain. For windy conditions maybe you would do something on each of the four corners of the photos instead. Once the photos were mounted, I was able to easily hang the canvas from a nail on my wall.
I don’t think I would use this on antique or vintage photos that you want to preserve. All of my photos were printed at Walgreens from my phone.
product_title: Scotch-Mount Indoor Double-Sided Mounting White Tape, 1 in x 125 in (10.4 ft), Features 3M Industrial Strength Adhesive, No Mess or Tools (314H-MED)

title: The Tape That Sticks With Me (Literally!)
author: pearls&palmtrees 🌴
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2025
review_text:
You may have heard of heavy-duty options like Alien Glue or Gorilla Glue, and there are plenty of double-sided tapes out there, but when it comes to small tasks around the house, THIS IS MY GO-TO. Whether I'm hanging lightweight items on my walls that don’t need nails, drywall anchors, or screws, this Scotch-Mount tape gets the job done without a hitch. It's reliable, easy to use, and has become an essential item in my home.

But be weary! While it’s fantastic for little jobs, don’t expect it to hold up larger items, especially if you're stubborn like me. I tried hanging a bigger piece—out of impatience, not wanting to deal with the necessary wall anchors—and within minutes, I heard a loud crash as it fell from the wall. So, little jobs? YES. Hanging a picture nearly half the size of your wall? NO.

As I write this, I’m sadly down to about 4-5 inches of tape, holding on to it like a desperate hoarder, but trust me, for smaller tasks, this tape is a total lifesaver. Highly recommend it, but maybe not for your most ambitious hanging projects!
product_title: Scotch-Mount Indoor Double-Sided Mounting White Tape, 1 in x 125 in (10.4 ft), Features 3M Industrial Strength Adhesive, No Mess or Tools (314H-MED)

title: Won’t be buying again
